name: MoneyV2
description:
A monetary value with currency.

To format currencies, combine this type's amount and currencyCode fields with your client's locale.

For example, in JavaScript you could use Intl.NumberFormat:

```js
new Intl.NumberFormat(locale, {
  style: 'currency',
  currency: currencyCode
}).format(amount);
```

Other formatting libraries include:

* iOS - [NumberFormatter](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/numberformatter)
* Android - [NumberFormat](https://developer.android.com/reference/java/text/NumberFormat.html)
* PHP - [NumberFormatter](http://php.net/manual/en/class.numberformatter.php)

For a more general solution, the [Unicode CLDR number formatting database] is available with many implementations
(such as [TwitterCldr](https://github.com/twitter/twitter-cldr-rb)).

Represents information about a customer of the shop, such as the customer's contact details, their order
history, and whether they've agreed to receive email marketing.

fields.name: canDelete
fields.description:
Whether the merchant can delete the customer from their store.

A customer can be deleted from a store only if they have not yet made an order. After a customer makes an
order, they can't be deleted from a store.

name: Order
description: An order represents an agreement to do business between a customer and a merchant.

fields.name: alerts
fields.description:
Generated messages that appear at the top of an order page in the Shopify admin.
For example, _this is a test order_.

fields.name: billingAddress
fields.description:
Mailing address provided by the customer.
Not all orders have mailing addresses.

fields.name: billingAddressMatchesShippingAddress
fields.description: Whether the billing address matches the shipping address.

fields.name: canMarkAsPaid
fields.description: Whether the order can be manually marked as paid.

fields.name: canNotifyCustomer
fields.description: Whether notifications can be sent to the customer or not.

fields.name: cancelReason
fields.description:
Reason the order was canceled.
Returns null if the order wasn't canceled.

fields.name: cancelledAt
fields.description:
Date and time when the order was canceled.
Returns null if the order wasn't canceled.

fields.name: capturable
fields.description:
Whether payment for the order can be captured.
Returns true when the customer's credit card has been authorized for payment and the authorization period has not expired.

fields.name: cartDiscountAmount
fields.description: Amount of the order-level discount (does not contain any line item discounts).

fields.name: cartDiscountAmountSet
fields.description: Amount of the order-level discount (does not contain any line item discounts) in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: Channel that created the order.

fields.name: clientIp
fields.description: The ip address of the client that is associated with this order.

fields.name: closed
fields.description: Whether the order is closed.

fields.name: closedAt
fields.description:
Date and time when the order closed.
If the order is not closed, then this field is null.

fields.name: confirmed
fields.description: Whether inventory has been reserved for the order.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Date and time when the order was created in Shopify.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description:
The currency of the store at the time of the order.
If payment hasn't occurred, then this field is null.

fields.name: customAttributes
fields.description:
Custom information added to the order by your customer
(Also referred to as note attributes).

fields.name: customer
fields.description:
Unique identifier of the customer who placed the order.
Not all orders have customers associated with them.

fields.name: customerAcceptsMarketing
fields.description: Whether the customer agreed to receive marketing materials.

fields.name: customerJourney
fields.description: Description of the customer's experience with the store leading up to the order.

fields.name: customerLocale
fields.description:
A two-letter or three-letter language code, optionally followed by a region modifier.
Example values could be 'en', 'en-CA', 'en-PIRATE'.

fields.name: discountApplications
fields.description: Discounts that have been applied on the order.

fields.description: Discount code provided by the customer.

fields.name: displayAddress
fields.description: Primary address of the customer, which is shown on the order.

fields.name: displayFinancialStatus
fields.description:
Financial status of the order that can be shown to the merchant.
This field does not capture all the possible details of an order's financial state and should only be used for display summary purposes.

fields.name: displayFulfillmentStatus
fields.description:
Fulfillment status for the order that can be shown to the merchant.
This field does not capture all the possible details of an order's fulfillment state. It should only be used for display summary purposes.

fields.name: disputes
fields.description: Summary of each dispute associated with the order. Sorted in ascending (ASC) order by ID.

fields.name: draftFulfillments
fields.description: List of possible fulfilments that can be made for the order (includes line items that can be partially fulfilled).

fields.name: email
fields.description: Email address provided by the customer.

fields.name: events
fields.description: List of internal events associated with the order.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
Unique identifier for the order that appears on the order.
For example, _#1000_ or _Store1001.
This value is not unique across multiple stores.

fields.name: netPayment
fields.description: Net payment for the order, based on the total amount received - total amount refunded.

fields.name: netPaymentSet
fields.description: Net payment for the order, based on the total amount received - total amount refunded in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: nonFulfillableLineItems
fields.description:
Line items that can't be fulfilled.
For example, because some or all of the items have been refunded, or the item is not one which can be fulfilled, such as a tip.
These line items would be 'lost' if you only considered the line items in draft fulfillments or fulfillments.

fields.name: physicalLocation

fields.name: presentmentCurrencyCode

fields.name: processedAt
fields.description:
Date and time when the order was processed.
When orders are imported from an app, this date and time may not match the date and time when the order was created.

fields.name: publication
fields.description: Publication that created the order.

fields.name: referralCode
fields.description:
Marketing referral code from the link that the customer clicked to visit your store.
Supports the following URL attributes: _ref_, _source_, or _r_. For example, if the URL is myshopifystore.com/products/slide?ref=j2tj1tn2, then this value is j2tj1tn2.

fields.name: referrerDisplayText
fields.description: Website that sent the customer to your online store.

fields.name: referrerUrl
fields.description:
Webpage where the customer clicked a link that sent them to your online store.
For example, _Google_ or _randomblog.com/page1_.

fields.name: refundable
fields.description: Whether the order can be refunded.

fields.name: refunds
fields.description: List of refunds that have been applied to the order.

args.description: Truncate the array result to this size.

fields.name: requiresShipping
fields.description: Whether any line item in the order requires physical shipping.

fields.name: restockable
fields.description: Whether the order can be restocked.

fields.name: riskLevel
fields.description: Fraud risk level of the order.

fields.name: risks
fields.description: The order risks associated with this order.

fields.name: shippingAddress
fields.description: Mailing address for shipping provided by the customer.

fields.name: shippingLine
fields.description: Line item that contains the shipping costs.

fields.name: subtotalLineItemsQuantity
fields.description: The sum of the quantities for the line items that contribute to the order's subtotal.

fields.name: subtotalPrice
fields.description: Subtotal of the line items and their discounts (does not contain shipping costs, shipping discounts, and order-level discounts).

fields.name: subtotalPriceSet
fields.description: Subtotal of the line items and their discounts (does not contain shipping costs, shipping discounts, and order-level discounts) in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: suggestedRefund
fields.description: The details of the suggested refund. This response can be used to submit a RefundCreate mutation.

args.name: shippingAmount
args.description: The amount to refund for shipping. Overrides `refundShipping`.

args.name: refundShipping
args.description: Whether to refund the full shipping amount.

args.name: refundLineItems
args.description: The line items from the order to include in the refund.

args.name: suggestFullRefund
args.description:
Whether a refund for all of the refundable line items on an order should be suggested.
If `true`, the suggested refund will be formed from all refundable line items and will
ignore any passed in `refundLineItems`.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: List of tags.

fields.name: taxLines
fields.description: Taxes charged for the line item.

fields.name: taxesIncluded
fields.description: Whether taxes are included in the subtotal price of the order.

fields.name: test
fields.description:
Whether the order is a test.
Test orders are made using the Shopify Bogus Gateway or the Shopify Payments test mode.

fields.name: totalCapturable
fields.description: Amount authorized for the order, that is uncaptured or undercaptured.

fields.name: totalCapturableSet
fields.description: Amount authorized for the order, that is uncaptured or undercaptured in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalDiscounts
fields.description: Total amount discounted from the order (includes order-level and line item discounts).

fields.name: totalDiscountsSet
fields.description: Total amount discounted from the order (includes order-level and line item discounts) in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalPrice
fields.description: Total amount of the order (includes taxes and discounts).

fields.name: totalPriceSet
fields.description: Total amount of the order (includes taxes and discounts) in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalReceived
fields.description: Total amount received by the customer for the order.

fields.name: totalReceivedSet
fields.description: Total amount received by the customer for the order in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalRefunded
fields.description: Total amount refunded for the order.

fields.name: totalRefundedSet
fields.description: Total amount refunded for the order in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalRefundedShippingSet
fields.description: Total amount refunded for shipping in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalShippingPrice
fields.description: Total amount charged for shipping the order.

fields.name: totalShippingPriceSet
fields.description: Total amount charged for shipping the order in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalTax
fields.description: Total of all taxes applied to the order.

fields.name: totalTaxSet
fields.description: Total of all taxes applied to the order in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalWeight
fields.description: Total weight (grams) of the order.

fields.name: transactions
fields.description: List of all transactions associated with the order.

args.name: first
args.description: Truncate the array result to this size.

args.name: capturable
args.description:
Filter transactions by whether they are capturable.
If true, then returns only transactions that represent an authorized payment that can be captured.
If false, then returns all transactions.

args.name: manuallyResolvable
args.description:
Filter transactions by whether they are manual payments.
If true, then returns only transactions that are manual payments. If false, then returns all transactions.

fields.name: unpaid
fields.description:
Whether no payments have been made for the order.
If no payments have been made for the order, then this returns true.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: Date and time when the order was last modified.

name: ResourceAlert
description:
Presents information or problems to merchants, with 1 or more actions that they can take.
They can optionally have a specific icon and be dismissed by merchants.

fields.name: actions
fields.description:
Buttons in the alert that link to related information.
For example, _View risk assessment_.

fields.name: content
fields.description: Details about the alert.

fields.name: dismissibleHandle
fields.description:
Unique identifier that appears when an alert is manually closed by the merchant.
Most alerts cannot be manually closed.

fields.name: icon
fields.description: Icon that displays with the alert.

fields.name: severity
fields.description: Indication of how important the alert is.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The name of the alert.

name: ResourceAlertAction
description: An action associated to a resource alert.

fields.name: primary
fields.description: Whether the action is primary or not.

fields.name: show
fields.description: Resource for the action to show.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Action title.

fields.name: url
fields.description: Action target URL.

name: MailingAddress
description:
Represents a customer mailing address.

For example, a customer's default address and an order's billing address are both mailling addresses.

fields.name: address1
fields.description: The first line of the address. Typically the street address or PO Box number.

fields.name: address2
fields.description: The second line of the address. Typically the number of the apartment, suite, or unit.

fields.name: city
fields.description: The name of the city, district, village, or town.

fields.name: company
fields.description: The name of the customer's company or organization.

fields.name: country
fields.description: The name of the country.

fields.name: countryCode
fields.description:
The two-letter code for the country of the address.

For example, US.

fields.name: countryCodeV2
fields.description:
The two-letter code for the country of the address.

For example, US.

fields.name: firstName
fields.description: The first name of the customer.

fields.name: formatted
fields.description: A formatted version of the address, customized by the provided arguments.

args.name: withName
args.description: Whether to include the customer's name in the formatted address.

args.name: withCompany
args.description: Whether to include the customer's company in the formatted address.

fields.name: formattedArea
fields.description: A comma-separated list of the values for city, province, and country.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: lastName
fields.description: The last name of the customer.

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: The latitude coordinate of the customer address.

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: The longitude coordinate of the customer address.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The full name of the customer, based on firstName and lastName.

fields.name: phone
fields.description:
A unique phone number for the customer.

Formatted using E.164 standard. For example, _+16135551111_.

fields.name: province
fields.description: The region of the address, such as the province, state, or district.

fields.name: provinceCode
fields.description:
The two-letter code for the region.

For example, ON.

fields.name: zip
fields.description: The zip or postal code of the address.

name: CustomerJourney
description: Represents a customer's activity on a shop's online store.

fields.name: customerOrderIndex
fields.description: The position of the current order within the customer's order history.

fields.name: daysToConversion
fields.description: The amount of days between first session and order creation date. First session represents first session since the last order, or first session within the 30 day attribution window, if more than 30 days has passed since the last order.

fields.name: firstVisit
fields.description: The customer's first session going into the shop.

fields.name: lastVisit
fields.description: The last session before an order is made.

fields.name: moments
fields.description: Events preceding a customer order, such as shop sessions.

name: CustomerVisit
description: Information about a customer's session on a shop's online store.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: landingPage

Supports the following URL attributes: _ref_, _source_, or _r_.
For example, if the URL is myshopifystore.com/products/slide?ref=j2tj1tn2, then this value is j2tj1tn2.

For example, _https://randomblog.com/page1_ or _android-app://com.google.android.gm_.

fields.name: source
fields.description:
Source from which the customer visited the store, such as a platform (Facebook, Google), email, direct,

fields.description: Describes the source explicitly for first or last session.

based on a combination of `marketingChannel`, `referringDomain`, and `type` to
provide a consistent representation for any given piece of marketing
regardless of the app that created it.

name: BulkOperation
description:
An asynchronous long-running operation to fetch data in bulk.

Bulk operations are created using the `bulkOperationRunQuery` mutation. After they are created,
clients should poll the `status` field for updates. When `COMPLETED`, the `url` field contains
a link to the data in [JSONL](http://jsonlines.org/) format.

See the [bulk operations guide](https://help.shopify.com/api/guides/bulk-operations) for more details.

fields.name: completedAt
fields.description: When the bulk operation was successfully completed.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When the bulk operation was created.

fields.name: errorCode
fields.description: Error code for failed operations.

fields.name: fileSize
fields.description: File size in bytes of the file in the `url` field.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: objectCount
fields.description: The running count of objects processed. This can be used to track operation progress.

fields.name: partialDataUrl
fields.description:
URL to partial/incomplete response data (in [JSONL](http://jsonlines.org/) format) returned by a failed operation.
Expires **one week** after the operation fails. Returns `null` when there's no data available.

fields.name: query
fields.description: GraphQL query document specified in `bulkOperationRunQuery`.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of the bulk operation.

fields.name: url
fields.description:
URL to the response data in [JSONL](http://jsonlines.org/) format.
Expires **one week** after the operation completes.

name: CommentEvent
description:
Comment events are generated by staff members of a shop.
They are created when a staff member adds a comment to the timeline of an order, draft order, customer, or transfer.

fields.name: appTitle
fields.description: The name of the app that created the event. Returns null when the event originates from the Shopify admin.

fields.name: attachments
fields.description: The attachments associated with the comment event.

fields.name: attributeToApp
fields.description: Whether the event was created by an app.

fields.name: attributeToUser
fields.description: Whether the event was caused by an admin user.

fields.name: canDelete
fields.description: Whether the comment event can be deleted. If true, then the comment event can be deleted.

fields.name: canEdit
fields.description: Whether the comment event can be edited. If true, then the comment event can be edited.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the event was created.

fields.name: criticalAlert
fields.description: Whether the event is critical.

fields.name: edited
fields.description: Whether the comment event has been edited. If true, then the comment event has been edited.

fields.name: embed
fields.description: The references associated with the comment event.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: message
fields.description: Human readable text that describes the event.

fields.name: rawMessage
fields.description: The raw body of the comment event.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: The subject of the comment event.

name: CommentEventAttachment
description: A file attachment associated to a comment event.

fields.name: fileExtension
fields.description: The file extension of the comment event attachment, indicating the file format.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: image
fields.description: The image attached to the comment event.

args.name: maxWidth
args.description: Image width in pixels between 1 and 2048. This argument is deprecated: Use `maxWidth` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: maxHeight
args.description: Image height in pixels between 1 and 2048. This argument is deprecated: Use `maxHeight` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: crop
args.description: Crops the image according to the specified region. This argument is deprecated: Use `crop` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: scale
args.description: Image size multiplier for high-resolution retina displays. Must be between 1 and 3. This argument is deprecated: Use `scale` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The filename of the comment event attachment.

fields.name: size
fields.description: The size of the attachment.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL of the attachment.

name: __Schema
description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

name: __Type
description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

name: __Field
description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

name: __Directive
description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

name: __EnumValue
description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

name: __InputValue
description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

name: BasicEvent
description:
Basic events chronicle resource activities such as the creation of an article, the fulfillment of an order, or
the addition of a product.

fields.name: appTitle
fields.description: The name of the app that created the event. Returns null when the event originates from the Shopify admin.

fields.name: attributeToApp
fields.description: Whether the event was created by an app.

fields.name: attributeToUser
fields.description: Whether the event was caused by an admin user.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the event was created.

fields.name: criticalAlert
fields.description: Whether the event is critical.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: message
fields.description: Human readable text that describes the event.

name: DiscountCodeApplication
description:
Discount code applications capture the intentions of a discount code at
the time that it is applied onto an order.

fields.name: index

fields.name: targetSelection
fields.description: How the discount amount is distributed on the discounted lines.

fields.name: targetType
fields.description: Whether the discount is applied on line items or shipping lines.
